intro: Adeneleuterophora linifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed adeneleuterophora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
